Browse the source code of netbsd/external/ibm-public/postfix/dist/src/cleanup/cleanup_out.c

1/* $NetBSD: cleanup_out.c,v 1.2 2017/02/14 01:16:44 christos Exp $ */
2
3/*++
4/* NAME
5/* cleanup_out 3
6/* SUMMARY
7/* record output support
8/* SYNOPSIS
9/* #include "cleanup.h"
10/*
11/* int CLEANUP_OUT_OK(state)
12/* CLEANUP_STATE *state;
13/*
14/* void cleanup_out(state, type, data, len)
15/* CLEANUP_STATE *state;
16/* int type;
17/* const char *data;
18/* ssize_t len;
19/*
20/* void cleanup_out_string(state, type, str)
21/* CLEANUP_STATE *state;
22/* int type;
23/* const char *str;
24/*
25/* void CLEANUP_OUT_BUF(state, type, buf)
26/* CLEANUP_STATE *state;
27/* int type;
28/* VSTRING *buf;
29/*
30/* void cleanup_out_format(state, type, format, ...)
31/* CLEANUP_STATE *state;
32/* int type;
33/* const char *format;
34/*
35/* void cleanup_out_header(state, buf)
36/* CLEANUP_STATE *state;
37/* VSTRING *buf;
38/* DESCRIPTION
39/* This module writes records to the output stream.
40/*
41/* CLEANUP_OUT_OK() is a macro that evaluates to non-zero
42/* as long as it makes sense to produce output. All output
43/* routines below check for this condition.
44/*
45/* cleanup_out() is the main record output routine. It writes
46/* one record of the specified type, with the specified data
47/* and length to the output stream.
48/*
49/* cleanup_out_string() outputs one string as a record.
50/*
51/* CLEANUP_OUT_BUF() is an unsafe macro that outputs
52/* one string buffer as a record.
53/*
54/* cleanup_out_format() formats its arguments and writes
55/* the result as a record.
56/*
57/* cleanup_out_header() outputs a multi-line header as records
58/* of the specified type. The input is expected to be newline
59/* separated (not newline terminated), and is modified.
60/* LICENSE
61/* .ad
62/* .fi
63/* The Secure Mailer license must be distributed with this software.
64/* AUTHOR(S)
65/* Wietse Venema
66/* IBM T.J. Watson Research
67/* P.O. Box 704
68/* Yorktown Heights, NY 10598, USA
69/*--*/
70
71/* System library. */
72
73#include <sys_defs.h>
74#include <errno.h>
75#include <stdlib.h> /* 44BSD stdarg.h uses abort() */
76#include <stdarg.h>
77#include <string.h>
78
79/* Utility library. */
80
81#include <msg.h>
82#include <vstring.h>
83#include <vstream.h>
84#include <split_at.h>
85#include <stringops.h>
86
87/* Global library. */
88
89#include <record.h>
90#include <rec_type.h>
91#include <cleanup_user.h>
92#include <mail_params.h>
93#include <lex_822.h>
94#include <smtputf8.h>
95
96/* Application-specific. */
97
98#include "cleanup.h"
99
100#define STR vstring_str
101
102/* cleanup_out - output one single record */
103
104void cleanup_out(CLEANUP_STATE *state, int type, const char *string, ssize_t len)
105{
106 int err = 0;
107
108 /*
109 * Long message header lines have to be read and written as multiple
110 * records. Other header/body content, and envelope data, is copied one
111 * record at a time. Be sure to not skip a zero-length request.
112 *
113 * XXX We don't know if we're writing a message header or not, but that is
114 * not a problem. A REC_TYPE_NORM or REC_TYPE_CONT record can always be
115 * chopped up into an equivalent set of REC_TYPE_CONT plus REC_TYPE_NORM
116 * records.
117 */
118 if (CLEANUP_OUT_OK(state) == 0)
119 return;
120
121#define TEXT_RECORD(t) ((t) == REC_TYPE_NORM || (t) == REC_TYPE_CONT)
122
123 if (var_line_limit <= 0)
124 msg_panic("cleanup_out: bad line length limit: %d", var_line_limit);
125 do {
126 if (len > var_line_limit && TEXT_RECORD(type)) {
127 err = rec_put(state->dst, REC_TYPE_CONT, string, var_line_limit);
128 string += var_line_limit;
129 len -= var_line_limit;
130 } else {
131 err = rec_put(state->dst, type, string, len);
132 break;
133 }
134 } while (len > 0 && err >= 0);
135
136 if (err < 0) {
137 if (errno == EFBIG) {
138 msg_warn("%s: queue file size limit exceeded",
139 state->queue_id);
140 state->errs |= CLEANUP_STAT_SIZE;
141 } else {
142 msg_warn("%s: write queue file: %m", state->queue_id);
143 state->errs |= CLEANUP_STAT_WRITE;
144 }
145 }
146}
147
148/* cleanup_out_string - output string to one single record */
149
150void cleanup_out_string(CLEANUP_STATE *state, int type, const char *string)
151{
152 cleanup_out(state, type, string, strlen(string));
153}
154
155/* cleanup_out_format - output one formatted record */
156
157void cleanup_out_format(CLEANUP_STATE *state, int type, const char *fmt,...)
158{
159 static VSTRING *vp;
160 va_list ap;
161
162 if (vp == 0)
163 vp = vstring_alloc(100);
164 va_start(ap, fmt);
165 vstring_vsprintf(vp, fmt, ap);
166 va_end(ap);
167 CLEANUP_OUT_BUF(state, type, vp);
168}
169
170/* cleanup_out_header - output one multi-line header as a bunch of records */
171
172void cleanup_out_header(CLEANUP_STATE *state, VSTRING *header_buf)
173{
174 char *start = vstring_str(header_buf);
175 char *line;
176 char *next_line;
177 ssize_t line_len;
178
179 /*
180 * Fix 20140711: Auto-detect the presence of a non-ASCII header.
181 */
182 if (var_smtputf8_enable && *STR(header_buf) && !allascii(STR(header_buf))) {
183 state->smtputf8 |= SMTPUTF8_FLAG_HEADER;
184 /* Fix 20140713: request SMTPUTF8 support selectively. */
185 if (state->flags & CLEANUP_FLAG_AUTOUTF8)
186 state->smtputf8 |= SMTPUTF8_FLAG_REQUESTED;
187 }
188
189 /*
190 * Prepend a tab to continued header lines that went through the address
191 * rewriting machinery. See cleanup_fold_header(state) below for the form
192 * of such header lines. NB: This code destroys the header. We could try
193 * to avoid clobbering it, but we're not going to use the data any
194 * further.
195 *
196 * XXX We prefer to truncate a header at the last line boundary before the
197 * header size limit. If this would undershoot the limit by more than
198 * 10%, we truncate between line boundaries to avoid losing too much
199 * text. This "unkind cut" may result in syntax errors and may trigger
200 * warnings from down-stream MTAs.
201 *
202 * If Milter is enabled, pad a short header record with a dummy record so
203 * that a header record can safely be overwritten by a pointer record.
204 * This simplifies header modification enormously.
205 */
206 for (line = start; line; line = next_line) {
207 next_line = split_at(line, '\n');
208 line_len = next_line ? next_line - 1 - line : strlen(line);
209 if (line + line_len > start + var_header_limit) {
210 if (line - start > 0.9 * var_header_limit) /* nice cut */
211 break;
212 start[var_header_limit] = 0; /* unkind cut */
213 next_line = 0;
214 }
215 if (line == start) {
216 cleanup_out_string(state, REC_TYPE_NORM, line);
217 if ((state->milters || cleanup_milters)
218 && line_len < REC_TYPE_PTR_PAYL_SIZE)
219 rec_pad(state->dst, REC_TYPE_DTXT,
220 REC_TYPE_PTR_PAYL_SIZE - line_len);
221 } else if (IS_SPACE_TAB(*line)) {
222 cleanup_out_string(state, REC_TYPE_NORM, line);
223 } else {
224 cleanup_out_format(state, REC_TYPE_NORM, "\t%s", line);
225 }
226 }
227}
